snippet: The European Commission blamed rising labor costs and high debt for sapping competitiveness in France and Italy, and also cited Spain and Slovenia for structural imbalances.
abstract: European Union economic official Olli Rehn warns struggling economies of France and Italy are out of step with better-performing countries like Germany, raising prospect of more trouble for euro zone; says they need to accelerate policy changes to improve competitiveness.
lead_paragraph: The European Commission blamed rising labor costs and high debt for sapping competitiveness in France and Italy, and also cited Spain and Slovenia for structural imbalances.

headline.seo: Italy and France Are Risks to Euro Zone, Report Says
headline.main: Italy and France Pose Grave Risks to Euro Zone, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Economies of France and Italy Are Risks to the Euro Zone, a Report Says
